channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hole in Pavement, 26th September
item.description:
A hole has appeared in the tarmac on the pavement. The hole is large enough for some to catch their foot in or a walking stick to go down. It is a trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Methuen Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between 54 and 56 Tennyson Road NW6 7SA, 26th September
item.description:
This problem was first reported on August the 5th but nothing has happened so far? Damage to adjacent properties is becoming worse. What are you expecting? Please act now.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tennyson Road, London

item.title: Outstanding Fly-Tipping Issue – Reported Paint Dumping, 26th September
item.description:
I am writing to follow up on a fly-tipping report I submitted on Wednesday regarding paint that had been dumped at Phelp Street SE17 . I noticed on Southwark fix my street website that the case has been marked as resolved. However, as of this evening, the dumped paint remains in the same location and has not been cleared. I would be grateful if the matter could be re-visited and the paint removed as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Phelp Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outstanding Fly-Tipping Issue – Reported Paint Dumping, 26th September
item.description:
Dear Southwark Council, I am writing to follow up on a fly-tipping report I submitted on Wednesday regarding paint that had been dumped at Phelp Street SE17. I noticed on your website- Southwark Fix my Street that the case has been marked as fixed. However, as of this evening, the dumped paint remains in the same location and has not been cleared. I would be grateful if the matter could be re-visited and the paint removed as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Phelp Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household items dumped in street, 26th September
item.description:
The constant dumping of household waste ruining the state of the street continues. These items strewn in the street present health and safety isssues as well as making the road an unpleasant environment.
